def has_remote_control(table: item):
    # Function to check if a specified table has a remote control on it
    symbol has_remote=exists o: item : is_remote_control(o) and on(o, table)
    return has_remote

behavior __goal__():
    body:
        if exists remote: item : is_remote_control(remote):
            # Check if there is a known remote control in the scene
            bind remote: item where:
                is_remote_control(remote)
            # Move the character closer to the remote control
            achieve close_char(char, remote) 

        else: 
           # If no remote control is found, initiate exploration to locate one
            foreach table: item:
                if is_table(table) and not visited(table):
                    observe(table,"Check if there is a remote control on the table")

            foreach couch: item:
                if is_couch(couch) and not visited(couch):
                    observe(couch,"Check if there is a remote control on the couch")

behavior ensure_tv_is_visible(tv:item):
    body:
        assert is_television(tv)   

behavior ensure_tv_is_accessible(tv:item):
    body:
        assert close_char(char, tv)

behavior __goal__():
    body:
        bind tv: item where:
            is_television(tv)
        ensure_tv_is_visible(tv)
        ensure_tv_is_accessible(tv)

        bind tv: item where:

behavior turn_on_tv_with_remote_control_action(remote_control:item, tv:item):
    body:
        achieve_once inhand(remote_control)
        achieve close_char(char, tv)
        assert plugged(tv)
        assert close(remote_control, tv)
        assert has_switch(tv)
        
behavior __goal__():
    body:
        bind remote_control: item where:
            is_remote_control(remote_control) and not visited(remote_control)
        bind tv: item where:
            is_television(tv) and id[tv]==248
        turn_on_tv_with_remote_control_action(remote_control, tv)
        achieve is_on(tv)
